name: family
sp_notes: The species name ancellae honours Museum of the Rockies field palaeontologist and fossil preparator Carrie Ancell, who discovered and prepared MOR 492, the holotype specimen of Stellasaurus ancellae, as well as the holotype of Achelousaurus horneri, and codiscovered the holotype of Einiosaurus procurvicornis, and whose decades of extraordinary fossil preparation have furthered vertebrate palaeontology beyond measure.

name: family
sp_notes: The species name marri is in honor of Dr. Ray H. Marr who produced the Society of Vertebrate Paleontology videos “We are SVP” and “About the SVP Logo” posted on the SVP website (vertpaleo.org), and who is a strong proponent of students at Southern Methodist University (SMU).

name: family
sp_notes: "The species name ritteri honors Polish-born physicist Johann Wilhelm Ritter whose discovery of ultraviolet light has allowed visualization of the soft tissues that are extraordinarily well-preserved in these new fossils."

name: both
sp_notes: "he species name honours Bailey Willis (1857–1949), a North American geologist who explored the Argentinean Patagonia during the first decades of the 20th century. As a consultant of the National Government of Argentina, Willis carried out multiple productive projects for the Patagonian region, including the utilization of the Limay River for generation of hydraulic energy."

name: family
sp_notes: The name augustai refers to the prominent Czech palaeontologist and prolific science populariser Josef Augusta (1903–1968).

name: family

name: family

name: family
sp_notes: "The genus name and specific epithet are in honor of Yang Zhongjian (C.C. Young), who is the founder of vertebrate paleontology in China"

name: both

name: family
sp_notes: Horneri, Latinized form of Horner, in honor of Jack Horner, in recognition of his successful field program in the Two Medicine Formation that has recovered many new species of dinosaurs that are critical for our understanding of the palaeobiology of dinosaurs in Laramidia, support in the preparation and curation of these specimens, and to acknowledge that his mentoring efforts have launched many professional scientific careers.

name: both
sp_notes: The species name acknowledges the importance of the underappreciated research by Robert Young on the Early Cretaceous of Utah

name: family
sp_notes: "The specific name honors Tulio del Bono, main authority of the Secretaría de Ciencia, Técnica e Innovación of the Government of San Juan, who is strongly collaborating and helping to develop our paleontology research in the San Juan Province."

name: family
sp_notes: "The specific name ‘Huang’ is in honour of Mr Huang, Wei-Long, who excavated the first dinosaurs in Zuoyun County and even Shanxi Province in 1957."

name: first
sp_notes: "Named in honour of Teresa Maryanska in recognition of her work on Asian dinosaurs."

name: family
sp_notes: specific name is in honor of Professor Louis L. Jacobs, who has contributed to dinosaur research and has given excellent mentoring to three authors (JLü, YL and YK) when they were Ph.D. students at Southern Methodist University, Dallas, Texas, USA.

name: family
sp_notes: "In honor of the paleontologist Giuseppe Leonardi, which dedicated greater part of his life to the study of the reptile ichnofauna from the northeastern Brazil."

name: family
sp_notes: Dedicated to US actor Clint Eastwood, the protagonist of the film “The Good, the Bad and the Ugly,” which was partially filmed near Salas de los Infantes.

name: family
sp_notes: "The species name “pabsti” honors the finder of the holotype specimen, Dr. Ben Pabst (born in Vienna, Austria, in January 26, 1949), who also created the skull reconstruction and led the repreparation of the specimen and its mount at SMA. Pabst has led several paleontological excavations in Switzerland and the USA, and is highly skilled in fossil preparation and skeleton mounting."

name: family
sp_notes: The species name, houi honors Dr. Hou Lianhai and his important contributions to Chinese paleornithology.

name: both

sp_notes: The specific name is an homage to Alsate, the legendary renegade last chief of the Chisos Apaches (Miles, 1976), and alludes to this hadrosaur being the last known to inhabit Texas prior to the terminal Cretaceous extinction event.

name: family
sp_notes: Species name honours Dr. Jorge González Parejas, who has collaborated and provided legal guidance on the research, protection and preservation of dinosaur fossils from Mendoza Province for nearly two decades. In so doing, he has advised researchers on the creation of a natural park that serves to protect dinosaur footprints in Mendoza.

name: family
sp_notes: The specific name honors Dr. Yoichi Azuma from Fukui Prefectural Dinosaur Museum, who co-organized and participated in several dinosaur expeditions in China. One of those expeditions led to the discovery of the basal neoceratopsian Archaeoceratops

name: family
sp_notes: The species name honours Robert M. Sullivan who discovered the holotype specimen, and whose work in the late Cretaceous of the San Juan Basin, New Mexico, has been instrumental in furthering knowledge of this key region for understanding the late Cretaceous of north America

The genus name also recalls the combining form of the Greek xxxxxx (philein), "to love", and the Latin venator, "hunter", suggesting a lover of the hunt.

sp_notes: The species name honors Helmut Doelling in recognition of his 50-plus years of geological research and mapping of Utah for the Utah Geological Survey.
